name: N~5~-(4-bromophenyl)-6-phenyl-1,2,4-triazine-3,5-diamine
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-1344

name: N~5~-(4-bromophenyl)-6-phenyl-1,2,4-triazine-3,5-diamine
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-1344
Reason: Basic unit, benzene has a melting point of about 5.5°C. Each additional phenyl group adds about +20°C due to increased molecular weight and π-π interactions. The -NH2 (amine) groups collectively add about +80°C due to hydrogen bonding capabilities and increased polarity. The bromine atom adds about +20°C due to increased molecular weight and van der Waals forces. The 1,2,4-triazine ring adds about +50°C because of its nitrogen heteroatoms which strongly influence the packing in the solid state and its potential for hydrogen bonding. These shifts are not simply additive but can give an estimated sum for predicting the melting point.
